dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vast, primordial jungle. Exotic, mist-shrouded mountainscapes loom in the gathering dusk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remote primeval landscape is bathed in strange, sweltering twilight. The setting sun is a weird fireball behind the palm trees. . The moon is a ghost on the horiz 3 EXT. CLEARING - NEPAL - NIGHT . A few tents pitched in the clearing...” A campfire burns... :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JUNGLE EXPEDITION has pitched camp. 6 NATIVES are stoki the campfire and cooking food. 3 PACK HORSES are tethered a post. THE PHOTOGRAPHER, is a ruggedly handsome American man in khaki jungle gear, several cameras slung around hi neck. He is reviewing a map with THE NATURALIST, a stunni and outdoorsy Australian woman. She is labeling numerous rolls of 35mm film with a magic marker.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: We're thirty miles northeast of the upper plateau. There's an outpost and an airstrip ten miles due north here... He points to a mark on the map.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: We can have the film flown out to Delphi from there. They can pouch it to the field office in Calcutta. Old Jones should be happy...we're only two weeks past deadline. She kisses him lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: NATURALIST
dialogues.text: This has been a wonderful adventure.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: You made it wonderful. He kisses her. They gaze into each other's eyes fondly.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Put it in your book. This September, The Amazon. January, Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: NATURALIST
dialogues.text: But in the next five minutes, bed.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: We're out here a thousand miles from civilization, a blanket stars above us, and she wants to sleep. a NATURALIST . I didn't say sleep, my love. Coming along? t PHOTOGRAPHER ; Hold it. In the last two months we've gotten pictures of every last living creature in this jungle paradise except you and I.

dialogues.speaker: NATURALIST
dialogues.text: And? ‘

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: I want one to show our grandkids. The Photographer sets a camera on a tripod, Sets it to autotimer. Goes over and poses with his girlfriend. VIEWFINDER P.O.V.: The two attractive people in a warm an loving embrace. CLICK. The shutter snaps The flashbulb flare white's them out. The flash refracts off the eyes of a strange creature watching them in the jungle. It GROWLS, a scary WOLFLIKE SOUND. The Photographer kisses The Naturalist fondly. She kisses him back. She puts her arms around him and they nuzzle in the remote reaches of the Indian jungle. Across the (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: clearing, their Native Guides are stoking the campfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Photographer and the Naturalist enter the tent. She s down and begins brushing her hair. He lifts his camera an SNAPS a few shots of his lovely girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: NATURALIST
dialogues.text: Stop it. He lowers his camera.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Okay. He takes her in his arms and they kiss in a passionate embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The full moon now visible in the darkened sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Native Guides stoke the coals of the fire with sticks They listen to the SOUNDS of the MONKEYS, BIRDS, and INSE in the dense trees lining the perimeter of the clearing. They hear the SOFT SIGHS coming from the one tent. The Natives exchange grins and shake their heads as they tend fire. Then all SOUNDS of WILDLIFE abruptly cease. Silence. The Native Guides lift their heads, alert. The jungle is totally, preternaturally quiet. One man rises to his feet uneasily. He nervously looks around him at the darkened clearing. It is pitch black on all sides beyond the dim g of the campfire. : The horses in the stalls begin to snort and paw the earth with their hoofs. The horses suddenly rear and yank at th tethers. Their wild eyes stare into the dark, silent jung Three Natives begin babbling anxiously to one another. Suddenly, a LOW GROWL emanates from the brush. Like a wol But not. famamrinron  10

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The horses rip loose of their posts and gallop off in pan into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Photographer and The Naturalist make passionate love sleeping bag...Their erotic sighs and exclamations drown all noises outside the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear explodes across the Guides' faces. They are frozen i place, paralyzed with terror. One looks over to see his rifle resting against his tent twenty yards away. _ Three Natives scream and bolt into the jungle. Two more of the Natives run off in the’ other direction. GROWL. With a cry of terror, the remaining Native Guide runs for rifle. A WEREWOLF drops out of the trees and goes for the man's throat! Bloodshot, insane eyes...Salivating fangs...Hairy half-ma half-wolf features...Huge claws. The creature is half-see a psychopathic-eyed apparition of fangs, claws, and fur i the firelight. The Native Guide's screams are cut short a he is torn to shreds by the Werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Photographer and the Naturalist are still making love the sleeping bag. Over their passionate sighs, he hears something outside the tent. He lifts his head.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Did you hear something? She nibbles his lip.

dialogues.speaker: NATURALIST
dialogues.text: Um-hmmmm. They kiss and continue what they were doing.  11 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Werewolf heaves the Native Guide's corpse into the tr The creature rears in the firelight, its talons and jaws dripping with gore. Its crazed, bloodshot eyes focus on the tent across the clearing. WEREWOLF P.O.V.: B&W. ITS HEART POUNDING IN IT'S CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Photographer rolls on top of the Naturalist in the sleeping bag. Her eyes widen as she sees the hideously unnatural silhouette of the Werewolf rear up outside the tent. She screams hysterically. The Photographer whirls just as the huge, razor-clawed paw shears through the ten canvas. She tries to crawl away, but the creature gets a fistful of her hair. It drags her right off her feet outs the tent. The Werewolf buries it's jaws into her. The gir screams and flails hysterically as she is held off the gr and ripped apart by the Werewolf. The man sees only flash of claws and snapping fangs amid the flying fur.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOO
dialogues.text: The Photographer leaps at the Werewolf. It whirls on him, slashing its razor fangs across his tor His shoulder is torn open, and he is tossed fifteen feet. The man lands on the ground by the backpacks, his shoulde mauled. His vision is BLURRY, semi-conscious. He sees the thing t the girl's dead body away like a rag doll. And it comes for him. The Photographer sees a shotgun. By the packs. He grabs up the shotgun and PUMPS a CARTRIDGE into the BREECH. FAnamatanron +  12 13 14

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He aims it at the Werewolf. The creature dives for him with a psychopathic SCREECH, talons extended. The man aims blindly, pulling the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BABOOOOOQOO0OOOOOCOOMMMMMMMM
dialogues.text: He blows the Werewolf's head clean off. It drops decapitated in the dirt, killed instantly. The Photographer slumps out cold on the ground, his eyes rolled up in their sockets... ’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH above the green, lush pine forest. Rugged, untamed natural scenery for miles and miles. Then, down below, at the edge of the woods, is nestled a comfortable, middle-c neighborhood of tract houses and safe, clean streets. The trees part and the quiet suburban town of "Forest Edge" spreads out before us. The HELICOPTER SHOT travels over t town to FRAME a house situated a bit secluded at the edge the woods. The SOUND of a DOG BARKING. THOR, a big, healthy, friendly German Shepherd leaps up a grabs a baseball.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT HARRISON
dialogues.text: Good dog! Bring it back, Thor. The canine scampers onto--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor takes the baseball onto the front lawn and drops it the feet of BRETT HARRISON, 10. The little boy roughhouse with his pet on the freshly cut lawn of their all-America home. Thor jumps and prances, dodging back into the stree to play catch again. faenwamranron +  14

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brett heaves the ball. ZOOM IN on Thor's eyes...

dialogues.speaker: HIM, HE LEAPS AND...
dialogues.text: Thor snatches the baseball. He pads back onto the lawn and drops it by Brett's feet.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Gimmie five. Thor enthusiastically puts his paw in Brett's hand.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Good boy. Yr Brett leans down and affectionately hugs Thor. The dog li the kid's face. Then his head lifts. In the distance, up the block... A man approaches. i The FLOPSY wears a dark suit and sunglasses, carrying an attache case. He is making good time up the sidewalk. Tho pays full attention. The Flopsy seems to be coming direct towards their house, ignoring the other houses on the way The dog's hackles rise. He wills them down. Flopsy comes up to the front yard. Near the boy. Behaving nonchalantly, Thor saunters across the lawn and places himself between Brett and Flopsy. The German Shepherd tak pains not to appear intimidating. Thor watches Flopsy. The man adjusts his dark glasses. Thor's hackles rise. He wills them down. He casts a glanc to Brett playing with the Frisbee. Then he returns his ga to Flopsy. The man doesn't seem to fear Thor, huge German Shepherd that he is. fanamranron +

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: Nice doggie. Thor just eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: NICE DOGGIE.
dialogues.text: Thor doesn't blink.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: You're a big one, aren't you? Are you a dog or a horse? Thor emits a low RUMBLE from deep in his throat. t Flopsy actually grins.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: He's not a horse! He's a German Shepherd! ‘ Thor sees Brett has come up from behind. The German Sheph easily positions himself between the disturbing man and t little boy. Flopsy wipes sweat from his brow.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: Well, he's a helluva big German Shepherd. Are your Mom and Dad home? Thor squints.

dialogues.speaker: ANKLES, TO HIS GROIN, TO HIS EXPOSED THROAT.
dialogues.text: Flopsy inches back a little. The screen door on the porch opens. JANET HARRISON, Mom, attractive, in her late 30's, hurries across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: Ah, you must be the lady of the house. Mom faces Flopsy. frawmranions  Bevery aay 7u wp 14

dialogues.speaker: DISHONEST.
dialogues.text: Thor's hackles rise.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: Well, Ma'am, I see you have a young boy. Are you helping him to get the best education possible? I represent The Pacific Northwest Magna Reading Project, and we have a series of books which studies have proved are a major benefit towards advanced learning in phonetics and word comprehension. If I could have five minutes of your time to show you-- r

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Thank you, but we really aren't interested in buying-- FLOPSY ‘ Please let me show you these books my company has developed-- He opens his attache case. Thor lets out a low, threatening GROWL;

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: I have them right here. Flopsy reaches his hand into his case. He eyes Thor with strange glint of opportunism in his eyes. Thor gives the man a single, vicious, snapping BARK.

dialogues.speaker: BEFORE HE BITES SOMEBODY
dialogues.text: Mom looks upset.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Thor. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVI4/19/90 (Pp) aue

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She reaches down to slip her finger into the metal ring o Thor's collar. As she does so, she takes her eyes off Flo for a moment. Flopsy makes deliberate eye contact with Thor. Thor sees Flopsy make a quick, flailing movement with his free hand over Mom's neck. Like he is about to punch her.

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: That does it. With a violent growl, Thor leaps. He hits Flopsy full in chest with front and hind legs, dropping him like a bowli pin. The ninety pound German Shepherd pins him to the pavement, police dog style. Flopsy looks in terror at the bared fangs of the dog at his throat. - .

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Thor looks up at Mom, and obediently gets off the man. Flopsy sits up, angrily brushing himself off.

dialogues.speaker: GOING TO PAY FOR IT
dialogues.text: LAWYER, LADY! ‘CAUSE YOU'RE GONNA HEAR

dialogues.speaker: FROM MINE, TOOT SWEET
dialogues.text: Janet stands over him, nonplussed.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: You- can talk to me. Mom pulls a small white card out of her wallet and tosses contemptuously to Flopsy.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I'm a lawyer. Before Flopsy can react, Janet reaches down and jerks the jacket from the man's shoulder. There is no wound.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I don't see what you're going to sue for, except maybe the price of a new suit at K-Mart.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, lady. I don't care if you are a lawyer. Your dog attacked me, and if you don't want to settle, fine. I won't sue you. I'll go to the humane society and show them what he did. I'll get a court order and have him destroyed. Baffled, Thor looks back and forth between Mom and Flopsy He lets out a low GROWL.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Get in the house, Thor! Mom points the dog towards the house. If possible, the German Shepherd is on the verge of tears of confusion and shame. He has no choice. He does what he is told. Thor slinks away, tail between his legs. He slumps on the porc and watches the heated interchange between his master and stranger who apparently threatened Mom. Mom faces Flopsy furiously as the man lies on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Did he bite you? Flopsy hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Because if he bit you, you'll have to see a doctor right now. Since you're on foot, I'll give you a lift to the nearest hospital emergency room right now. Janet holds out her hand to help the man up.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I'll take you to our family doctor.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: I got my own doctor!

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: All right. I think I've heard about enough, Flopsy.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Who's Flopsy, Mom? Janet stares down Flopsy. panamrnrons

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: A flopsy, Brett, is a con man who does things like walk in front of cars and pretend to get hit. Or intentionally provoke people's dogs and pretend to get bitten. He threatens to sue people or have their pets destroyed unless they pay him money. I've prosecuted plenty of these guys.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: I'll--I'1ll see you in court. The con man fidgets like a pinned bug. Thor watches Mom's demeanor from the sidelines, and his German Shepherd jowl break into a loose grin as he sees whatever it is going o Mom is winning. JANET . Brett, call Sheriff Jenson. Tell him you're my son, he'll take the call. Tell him we have a problem and to send a. -deputy right away. . Janet turns to Flopsy. with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: It was nice knowing you, Flopsy. I'll visit you in the slammer.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: YOU F--! i The man explodes in anger. Thor leaps up on his haunches and BARKS violently. Mom whirls on Thor and roars ferociously.

dialogues.speaker: STAY
dialogues.text: With a dismal WHINE of dismay, Thor miserably hangs back the stoop. His eyes still remain protectively fixed on Flopsy.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Now, my advice to you is to turn around, and walk away without saying another word and without looking back. The humiliated con man stumbles away up the sidewalk. He wags his finger at Janet. (CONTINUED )

If you bite somebody they can take you away from us and take you to the pound and there wouldn't be anything we could do. You're the man of the house, Thor. What would we do without the man of the house, huh?

The SOUND of his BOOTS CRUNCHING TWIGS. Then suddenly...all the ANIMAL NOISES in the forest stop. Silence. The Hiker stops and listens-to the uncanny, preternatural quiet. Beaded with sweat, he fumbles in his backpack for a battery. He frantically inserts it into his flashlight. The beam of light blinks back on. The SOUND of a HUGE ANIMAL SMASHING THROUGH THE TREES AND BRANCHES of the FOREST. The Hiker cries out in fear and runs for his life... He h off his backpack and bolts up the trail. dialogues.text: The branches part... And Thor is face to face with A WEREWOLF. It is handcuffed to a big tree. Though it is manlike in size and build, it is hideously unnatural. The Werewolf's face and body are completely covered with thick patches of black pubic-like hair. Cove with fur, it stands upright, on its hind legs, with its f legs wrapped around the tree trunk, held together by Uncl Ted's handcuffs. It wears Uncle Ted's sweatpants and the ragged remains of his sweatshirt, and a small metal objec dangles from a chain around its neck. The key to the handcuffs. Its face distends in a wolf-like snout. Two -grotesquely long fangs protrude from its exposed gums. I fangs are sharp and very dangerous-looking. It has been trying to cut through the tree trunk with them, and has gnawed a big hunk out of the tree before giving up on the idea. The Werewolf hasn't seen Thor yet. The German Shepherd backs slowly, silently, into the surrounding bushes, then edges in for a closer look. The Werewolf is chained to the lone tree in the clearing, the moon, now high in the sky, beams down on it like a spotlight. The creature's attention is torn between the moon and the handcuffs that bind it. It struggles awhile, tires, then gazes upward. It glowers at the moon, its fac picture of hate. The only sound that comes from the Werewolf is the same constant LOW GROWL Thor had heard in distance. The German Shepherd watches the creature with a mixture o apprehension and befuddlement. Thor sniffs the ground and locates one of Uncle Ted's sneakers. He sniffs it, looks the Werewolf, and a WHINE of confusion escapes his throat The Werewolf hears him and snaps his head around to see t interloper. At the sight of Thor, the Werewolf flies into a mad rage. Thor tenses and bares his teeth, ready to fight, but the handcuffs restraining the creature hold. The Werewolf can famamesnron +  69

The Werewolf's fury makes it foam at the mouth, and despite its helpless stat it shows no fear, only rage. Even helpless, locked to the tree, it urges Thor closer, wanting any opportunity to tr kill him. It is utterly mad. Their eyes meet. Thor freezes. The Werewolf's eyes are neither canine nor human, but resembling both. Its psychotic, anarchic gaze seems to beckon to Thor, inviting him to join the Werewolf in its wildness, in its freedom, in its madness...its power te kill. Thor stares if hypnotized, struggling against the primal seduction of animal bloodlust. The German Shepherd shakes to his very bones, unable to b the creature's gaze. dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I thought they said it was a grizzly bear.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: Wolves, bears, it's the same difference. I just think you should be more cautious, and take the dog more seriously. And don't let him go out there either. . JANET i Ted, don't you think you're overdoing it a little? Thor isn't exactly, helpless, you know.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: How big is he in pounds?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Are you ready for this? One ‘hundred and five pounds!

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: You know how big grey wolves get? Up to two hundred!

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Ted, give me a break! The dog starts barking in the night, and now you've got a@ two hundred pound wolf at the door! Are you feeling okay? She puts down the pan and looks at her brother. Uncle Ted gets up and walks to the sink, his back to his sister.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: Oh, Janet. I shouldn't be here. I really should not be...anywhere near here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75  59A. Rev.23/04/96 (Goldenrod)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He takes a deep breath, fighting an urge he can't resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving. Today. . one (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mom looks up, startled.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: You just got here. He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: I have to go. Janet gets up and tentatively puts a hand on Uncle Ted's to massage the muscles between his shoulders. Uncle Ted doesn't respond. She leans against his back and runs her hands down his arms to take hold of his wrists. He flinches and gasps. She immediately lets go.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your wrists? Shock hits”her. She doesn't want to know the answer.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I said, what's wrong with your WRISTS, Ted? Janet pulls the sleeves up. She sees the wrists have been bandaged. She looks at her brother in alarm. JANET ‘ Ted, you look me in the eye. Ted doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Look me in the eye and you tell me that you. didn't cut your wrists. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Uncle Ted looks Janet in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: I didn't cut my wrists. Uncle Ted cracks a nihilistic grin.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: Believe me when I tell you you wouldn't believe me if I told you. Janet stares through her brother's head. She touches her brother's shoulder and massages it in sisterly fashion.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Promise me, promise me, you'll stay here until...until you work things out. Please. Thor watches the proceedings with mortal dread, a low WHI escaping him as he realizes the depth of Mom's attachment her brother. Uncle Ted turns. He puts his face in his hands. He doesn' cry. He just stands that way for what:seems like an eternity, thinking. Then he draws his fingers slowly down and off his face.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: I'll try. They hug again. i Uncle Ted shoots Thor a spooky glance. FREEZE FRAME on th man's eye... 75  Rev: 4/19/96 (p).
The sky is shot with twilight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is darkening fast. The dog walks to the foot of the Airstream. Sees Uncle Te silhouette behind the drapes. Thor sits on the grass and waits as the sky darkens over the pines. Ted opens the door and steps out on the landing in his br new sweatsuit. He takes one step, sees Thor, and stops short. A worried look on his face, he goes back inside th Airstream and closes the door. A beat. . Uncle Ted pulls a drape away from the window. Sees Thor still on the grass. Closes the drape. Thor makes himself comfortable on the grass. Uncle Ted looks out the window again. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he comes out on the landing. He stands looking d at Thor for a moment, then looks over his shoulder at the blackening eastern horizon. With a look of resignation on his face, he tentatively starts down the stairs, pausing briefly on each step to gauge Thor's réaction. Thor sits in place, watching him. Uncle Ted sets foot on the pavement, less than three feet from Thor, who sits motionless the whole time. Slightly emboldened and growing more desperate by the sec Uncle Ted cautiously begins walking towards the woods. Th immediately gets up and follows him, maintaining a consta distance of about ten feet between them. s Uncle Ted turns on the German Shepherd angrily with his held out straight, pointing towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: Piss off! Thor ignores him. ~ Uncle Ted is beginning to look as nervous as a cornered OZ. animal. He steps towards Thor and slowly, tentatively, (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: reaches for his choker collar. Thor's lip curls, showing Vee his fangs, a low GROWL rumbling from his throat. Uncle Te wisely withdraws his hand. He is running out of time. The sky is completely dark, and the moon is peeking over the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TED
dialogues.text: Hey, sis! Would ya take the dog in? I'm goin' for a run. He takes a nervous step towards the house. Thor blocks his way and quietly snarls at him. No way is going into the house. Rubbing his chin nervously, Uncle Ted heads back towards Airstream. Thor follows him to the Airstream steps and le Uncle Ted go back inside himself.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Thor! C'mon in! Bedtime! Thor looks’ at Mom standing in the kitchen doorway, then Uncle Ted. He is torn between obedience and instinct.

dialogues.speaker: THOR
dialogues.text: Thor walks up to Janet, looks her straight in the eye, an BARKS a few times in an attempt to convey the seriousness the mission. Mom doesn't get it. Obviously concerned abou the dog's strange behavior, Janet takes a deep breath and speaks patiently.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Get in here. Thor climbs the steps into the kitchen and sits down with disgusted GRUNT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom closes the kitchen door. Behind her back, through the window, Uncle Ted runs for the woods as if the Devil hims were on his tail. Janet doesn't see him. She kneels down by Thor. \e Ss f it Lf (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: What's with you? She scratches the dog. Thor looks up at her with pleading eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: You be a Good Dog, alright? Mom pets Thor gently. Thor WHINES for a second, then give up. Mom goes upstairs to bed. Thor gets up and looks through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor WHINES, but swallows his bark. . He hears something in the house. ' Thor whirls, bracing in alarm. It's Brett.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: What's wrong, boy? Thor jumps his paws up on the kitchen door, scratching th glass. Thor seems torn with trying to'warn Brett back fro the approaching danger, and trying to get out.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: You wanna go OUT? Thor leaps off the kitchen door, WHINING and fidgeting uncontrollably while he waits for Brett to open it.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Sure, boy. Brett's hand turns the knob. As soon as an inch of space appears, Thor wedges in his snout and shoves his body thr the door. Before Brett can regain his balance, Thor has crossed the yard and disappeared into the woods. 78  Rev 4/19/96 (p) 79 80

dialogues.speaker: SNIFFING ON THE SOUNDTRACK, NOSE TO THE TRAIL...
dialogues.text: Thor sees Uncle Ted's running clothes, torn to shreds. Trotting further, he sees the sneakers, also ripped up. Thor stops. On the ground glints something metallic... The handcuffs. Thor bolts upright with a YELP of alarm, his head swiveli back towards the house. He takes off in a dead, desperate run back for the house like the ground was on fire. The forest flies past him in a dark blur. . The German Shepherd bursts out of the Woods, bounding acr the stream onto--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Werewolf is at the edge of the yard. Thor BARKS savagely. He leaps straight for the Werewolf's throat. The creature's foot sweeps up and kicks Thor in the ribs, slamming him sideways into a tree. The dog hits the ground. The Werewolf kicks its half-canine, half-human leg up int Thor's jaw, smashing him against another tree and bouncin him off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: WEREWOLF COMING AT HIM WITH TALONS EXTENDED.
dialogues.text: Thor staggers to his feet. The Werewolf picks him up by the throat and bares its dangerous rows of razor fangs, ready to rip the German Shepherd's head off.  81 82 83 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet bursts out of the bedroom, hearing the commotion outside. She runs to the wall and throws a security syste switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A special set of security system floodlamps pop on in a bright flare of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a howl of agony, the Werewolf slams its sensitive ey shut from the piercing glare of the floodlights. The monster recoils from the sudden flood of light. Its f is bathed in the glare. Saliva smearg the creature's mout Startled by the house lights, the Werewolf drops Thor and dashes for the creek and the sheltering shadows of the forest. Thor shakes his head clear.

dialogues.speaker: STAGGERING FOR THE FOREST.
dialogues.text: Thor charges, targeting the Werewolf's trailing ankle. The Werewolf gets to the creek. Thor's head shoots out, his jaws viciously snapping at th retreating ankle. His teeth clamp shut on flesh and he te some off. Blood spurts. The Werewolf lets out a subdued yelp as Thor falls back o the other side of the creek. The creature twists and swin a clawed hand at Thor's nose, nicking it. It glances hatefully at Thor for the briefest instant before dashing across the creek into the deep shadows of the forest. Thor gasps for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett slowly closes the curtain, retreating in horror fro the scene he has secretly witnessed. Lanamranren ©  Rev:4/19/90 \p) 67.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: M-Mommy... The little boy is pale as a sheet. Thor's URGENT BARKING reverberates from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor stands by the fence, BARKING and BARKING in warning. Harrison house lights are turning on. The back door opens and Mom steps out holding a flashlight, still half asleep

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Who's out here! Thor runs over to block her way, BARKING URGENTLY, trying back Janet into the house. She walks outside, shining the flashlight around. Thor BARKS FURIOUSLY, and tries to blo Mom's way, keeping one eye out for therWerewolf. Janet doesn't even slow down, merely acts annoyed. Janet keeps scouting the back of the house with.the flashlight. Thor' shepherding instincts are in full command. He runs in fro --of Mom and BARKS to warn her off. It only annoys Janet further. Janet shines the flashlight on Thor. She gasps a she sees the speckles of blood on his snout. She kneels d and touches the cut on his nose. -

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: What happened, Thor? Janet is terribly concerned as she shihes the flashlight Thor's coat and sees the multitude of scratches and cuts.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Hey, boy, what did this to you? How did you get cut? The dog looks straight ahead, haunted. Thor WHIMPERS.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Was it another dog? No, it wasn't that. Was it a rat, or a raccoon? A person? The dog doesn't react.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I wish you could talk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Thor turns to look Janet square in the eye. The woman is taken aback by the clear intelligence of the stare.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Thor... Thor WHIMPERS, gazing sentry-like around them.

dialogues.speaker: MOMMY
dialogues.text: Janet looks up to see Brett, pale as a ghost, standing at bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet rushes in, grabs the phone, and dials 911. JANET . This is Janet Harrison at 43 Oak Creek Lane. I need Sheriff Jenson, please. ‘Right now. ' Brett comes to the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Mommy, I saw something! Janet shoots him a glance.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: BRETT, STAY UPSTAIRS! Hello, Sheriff? Thor patrols the perimeter of the kitchen. Fear is in his eyes as he stares out at the darkened forest. Through the kitchen window, Janet hangs up the phone and goes upstair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet sits on Brett's bed. Brett has the covers pulled up his nose, absolutely terrified. Mom strokes Brett's hair softly.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as werewolves, Brett. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 CONTINUED : - ge Brett is barely able to hold back tears. —_ BRETT I saw it, and...I think it saw me! The little boy pulls the covers up around his chin, his breathing rapid and shallow.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Whatever it was, it wasn't a Werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: It...it was hairy all over, and it had long teeth. But...it looked like a man. Janet sees the Werewolf model kit on Brett‘s dresser. She picks it up and shows it to him. JANET “ Did it look like this one? |

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: -Kind of. But the ears were tonger. And it had a longer snout. And it...I think it had more hair. That one's just from a movie. —_ Janet smiles lovingly. She puts down the model.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I see. You sure you weren't having a bad dream? i

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: NOt ZI went to the bathroom, and I heard something, and I looked out the window, and the Werewolf came toward the house. Then Thor came and fought with him and chased him away. Janet suppresses a smile. She looks at her boy and rubs h tired eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JANET _
dialogues.text: Are you sure this Werewolf wasn't Thor?

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: No, Mom! Thor was in the woods! He came back after the Werewolf tried to get in the house! He chased him through the neighbor's fence! saArsmmterron  88 89

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Janet sighs, thinks a long beat. She can't believe Brett what he said and isn't sure what to say to him.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Well, look. As long as Thor chased him away, we're safe, right? And Thor is in the house now, so I'm sure if there is a Werewolf out there, he won't try anything. We can figure this out tomorrow, okay? Janet tousles the boy's hair and gets off the bed. She go to the door. Dog tired.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Yeah, sweetheart? . BRETT . Could you leave the door open a crack?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Sure. Go to sleep, Brett. Janet departs, leaving the door open a few inches. The boy lies in bed. In a moment, the familiar protective pad of paws on the carpet, and Thor peers through the crack in the door. The big German Shepherd wedges open the door with his nose. H crosses the room and stands by Brett's bed. The little bo pets him.

dialogues.speaker: BRETT
dialogues.text: We know, don't we, Thor? Thor climbs onto the bed and lies down beside Brett, putt his body between the boy and the door. Reassured by Thor' presence, Brett drops to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet walks out into the darkened back yard. She knocks o the door of the Airstream.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Ted? EAnemrinens  89

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She knocks again.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Ted, you in there? Janet turns towards the woods. Did she hear something out there? She ignores it, and knocks again. The door slides open. Unlocked. Janet almost doesn't go in. Then she does

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet stands inside the dark and apparently empty trailer

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Ted? Janet switches on the desktop light. The place is neat. Janet looks in the bathroom. .

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: _Ted? Then she sees something on the desk. An open folder. A pi of snapshots. Marjorie. Janet picks up one of the snapshots. And sees the others...The self-timed photo of Uncle Ted and Marjorie they shot in Nepal. Janet cannot resist flipping through them. Marjorie was a looker.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Nice. . Then she sees the next picture...And chokes back vomit. Marjorie's savaged, mutilated remains, shot during daylig hours in the Nepal forest.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Ohhhhh, my God. There's more. A mauled dead Native Guide. Janet stares at Marjorie's corpse in horrified fascination.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Marjorie...What.-.?

dialogues.speaker: THE YARD. THE SOUND OF HARSH BREATHING ON THE SOUNDTRACK.
dialogues.text: srewnranren y  Rev:4.19/96 (p)

Janet puts down the pictures, swallowing to stop from puk And sees the open journal. She has to read it. She flips through the pages, noting the steady deteriorat of Uncle Ted's handwriting into a savage, desperate scraw She reads in the lamplight. UNCLE TED V.O. "December 23rd, 1995. Marjorie's body will be buried in Nepal. Saw the local police here. Got the wound taken care of, Maybe my limited understanding of the language, but the doctor didn't seem to want to discuss the type of animal that attacked me and Marjorie. I could see fear written all over on his face..." Janet flips on. UNCLE TED V.O. “December 28th, 1995. Stateside. Saw doctor here. Had blood test. Doctor couldn't identify strain. Some infection that isn't on the books. Had another blackout last night. Woke up in the woods. Bad dreams still in black and white..." Janet flips forwards. UNCLE TED V.O. "December 29th, 1995. Blacked out again. Woke in the woods. Blood on me. Not mine... December 30th, 1995. Bought handcuffs." 93 EXT. HARRISON HOUSE —- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet reads aloud in horrible fascination.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: “January 4th, 1996. Tonight I remain myself. Lucid. Human. I realize that my condition was caused by the bite of the creature. The disease is transfered through the saliva into the bloodstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on Janet's face as she flips forwards to the last entry. UNCLE TED V.0. "January 10th, 1996. I have tried all medical solutions, to no effect. There is no known cure in medicine. But maybe...just maybe...there is hope for me. Janet and Brett came up to the house today. To see her again did my heart good. It rejuvenated me. I felt normal, human again. She has invited me to stay with her, and perhaps if I spend time with her, with my family, this disease will go into remission. Medicine will not stave off this disease. But perhaps love, the restorative power of love, family love...will save me. It is my last chance." Janet puts down the journal. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Puts her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Oh, Ted. She stands in the Airstream, holding the journal. Through the open door, something darts outside in the dar

dialogues.speaker: GRABS AHOLD OF THE KNOB.
dialogues.text: And we see it's Flopsy! The sleazy con man Janet ran off at the outset tightens t stocking over his face and peers through the back-door. H mutters beneath his breath. - FLOPSY — : Nobody makes a fuckin' fool outta me, lady. i He has a thick sirloin steak in one fist. A meat cleaver in the other.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: Here, Poochie, Poochie... ‘ His face breaks into a sleazeball grin as he opens Flopsy pushes open the door.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: Here, doggie. C'mere ya stupid friggin’ dog... GGGGGGRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR. -- « He stops cold. A monstrous shadow rears over his own on the wall. Werewolf GROWLS behind his back...

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: N-nice d-doggie... the lock. The (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Flopsy freezes, slowly turning as the monster rises to it full height behind him. His eyes widen in speechless terr as he sees the Werewolf face to face, its jagged fangs spilling saliva, its hot, fetid breath condensing in air. Flopsy regards the Werewolf blankly.

dialogues.speaker: FLOPSY
dialogues.text: Bullfuckingshit. He raises the cleaver. With a powerful swipe of its razor talon, the Werewolf rips off Flopsy's knife hand at the wrist. The man's eyes bug out as he sees his blood-goutin severed stump. He is about to scream. A second swipe of the Werewolf's talon detaches his laryn with the better part of his throat. The creep tries to run for it. He gets two feet. The Werewolf swipes it's talon, tearing a gaping cavity i the man's torso and heaving him through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flopsy flies like a tossed rag doll through the branches lands on the ground. Physically unable to scream, he clambers to his feet. His throat jets blood as he scrambl in agony and terror through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: MILLS
dialogues.text: Ggggggagggggg..- He runs for his life, looking over his shoulder to see th huge, bloodthirsty shape of the Werewolf smashing headlon through the undergrowth after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor stands protectively by the door, on full alert. The watches the woods. PUSH IN ON his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ™~ Flopsy staggers bloodlessly onto a--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And stands stuperously on the two-lane blacktop. He turns, his face blinded by headlights... As the POLICE CAR comes speeding around the corner, SIREN WAILING, SLAMMING on its BRAKES too late. Flopsy is hit by the car at 50 MPH. His shattered body is flung twenty feet into the air, and lands on top of the police car, shattering the cherrytops showers of sparks and blood. . Sheriff Jenson climbs out of the patrol car. He regards t twisted pile of meat adorning his squad car that is all t remains of- the con man. . 100 DELETE. “~ 101 DELETE. 102 DELETE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is lightening over the rugged woods and tract hou en 98 99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet stands by the window with Thor. She looks up to see a POLICE HELICOPTER soar overhead, it searchlight beacon passing across the massive expanse of woods. She pats Thor.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Easy, boy. The DOORBELL RINGS. Janet jumps. Goes into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet opens the door. Sheriff Jenson stands there, his face grim. He is backlit the flashes of a squad car in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff... Sheriff Jenson walks in, his hat in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor sits by the kitchen door, staring, sentry-like out t window at the Airstream and the backyard in the morning light. He doesn't have to wait long. Through the window, he sees Uncle Ted step from the woods He walks hunched over, clutching his bloodied ankle with hand. Thor GROWLS quietly to himself. He watches Uncle Te with growing hostility as the man hops up the stairs to h trailer. The door closes. Thor lies down on the floor, knowing the "pack" is safe for awhile. 104 105 106  Rev:4/19/96 (p) 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet faces Sheriff Jenson. He shows her Flopsy's driver' license.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF JENSON
dialogues.text: Is this the man who approached your place last month?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF JENSON
dialogues.text: He's dead. Janet gasps.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF JENSON
dialogues.text: His name was Walter Mills. -I hit him in my patrol car tonight, respending to your call. He ran out into the middle of the -road, and I didn't have time to stop. But the thing of it is, the car isn't what killed him. He bore the marks of an animal attack. He had been torn open. By a big animal. Like a wolf. Or... Janet holds the Sheriff's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Or a dog, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF JENSON
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma'am. I do recall you told me that Thor almost took a bite out of Mills the other day. Now maybe tonight, when Mills came back, Thor went at him again. The woman rubs her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Thor got into a fight. Tonight, with someone, or something. He has cuts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF JENSON
dialogues.text: I see. Janet picks up Uncle Ted's journal and fingers it. She lo at Sheriff Jenson, deeply disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: You know about these slayings up in the Skyline area? Those hikers that were mutilated?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF JENSON
dialogues.text: Yes, Janet. I'm in daily contact with the Skyline Law Enforcement people. We're keeping a watch on the paths of the killings. But that wouldn't be the same animal that killed Mills. It would have had to travel two hundred miles from Skyline to get here and-- .

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: No, that's not it. My question is... Is ‘there any possibility that the killings were committed by a...human being? Sheriff Jenson shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF JENSON
dialogues.text: No chance at all, Janet. They were done by a big animal. No man could tear a person apart the way the beast that butchered those people did. ' Same with Mills tonight. Wolves are the probable culprits. Very, very big wolves. But not a man. Not humanly possible. Why do you ask? Janet rubs her eyes, worried.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I don't know. Janet ponders, most uneasy. Sheriff Jenson grabs his hat. : Goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF JENSON
dialogues.text: I reckon that's all for now, Janet. We'll be in touch. Just one thing. I know you love Thor. And if he did tear up Mills, he was doin’ so to protect you. But once a dog becomes a biter, gets a taste for human blood, he becomes dangerous. With all due respect, Ma'am, (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fanemranmon  107 108 ove

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHERIFF JENSON (cont'd) your little boy and all, I suggest you consider shoppin' fer another hound. Janet shows no expression. She lets the Sheriff out and watches through the window as his car tools off down the street. She walks into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet comes down to the kitchen. Thor notices nervously that Mom is quietly keeping an eye him.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Hi, Thor. THOR P.O.V.: B&W. MOM. EDGY. . JANET .

dialogues.speaker: CAUTIOUS. MOM IS AFRAID OF HIM.
dialogues.text: Thor regards Janet with shock. Janet leans down to touch Thor, but it is with wariness. JANET i Hey, Thor, how'd you like to go outside? Thor watches Mom carefully, reactively. Janet opens the kitchen door. Thor obediently goes outside. Janet watches through the window as the German Shepherd g like a magnet to Uncle Ted's Airstream to resume his watc

dialogues.speaker: JANET
